info.title: Serpstat Keyword Volume Checker API
info.description:
### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 â€” Endpoint URL, through which all requests should be processed.

### API protocol

- Our API protocol is [**JSON-RPC 2.0**](https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification).

### Requests

- All requests should be sent via **POST** method.
- All request parameters must be set via POST request body in **JSON** format.
- Each request should contain a `method` name parameter corresponding to the API method (case-sensitive).

### Authentication

- Tokens are used for authentication. Create a token on [your profile page](https://serpstat.com/users/profile/). 
- `token` is required for all API requests.
- Api token is available for almost paid and trial plans that have API feature enabled.

### Pagination

For pagination, use the parameters:
- `size`: number of results per page (default 100, maximum 1000);
- `page`: page number (default is 1st page).

Please note: not all methods are supporting pagination.


### Filters

Filters can be applied to each method, most of them are specific for the method you used.
`filters` object are optional for most methods.

### Responses

- All responses are in **JSON** format.
- All responses have 200 HTTP status, even erroneous ones. In case of error, the response contains an `error` object instead of `result`.


### Credits and pricing

- This API has separate billing and credits type for this API are not included in any available subscription plan. [Contacts sales](https://data.serpstat.com/api-keyword-volume-checker/) for details.
- The cost varies from $0.001 to $0.0005 depending on the volume of credits required
- The minimum budget for the service is $300 
- Unlimited number of requests per day and month.
- Credits for SERP Crawling don't expire at the end of the month, you can use them when it is convenient for you.
- All keywords accepted to task are billed after task submission.
- Charged credits are not refundable.

### Request rates

Most subscription plans are limited to 1 request per second.
Top-tier plans allow up to 10 requests per second.
For higher rate limits, contact our sales team.
Exceeding your rate limit will result in an error response.

### Max results

The maximum number of results returned by each API method is limited up to 60,000 rows.

post.description:
The `SerpstatTaskProcedure.addKeywordListFreq` method sends keywords to volume parsing and returns a unique task key to be used for `SerpstatTaskProcedure.getTaskResult` to get parsing results. Keywords must be transferred as an array.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: this method corresponds to specific limits. 
You will find conditions and price details [here](https://data.serpstat.com/api-keyword-volume-checker/)

accepted.description: Total number of keywords set for parsing excluding blocked

duplicates_cleaned.description: The number of duplicated keywords that have been cleared, the credits for them will not be charged.

blocked.description: Array with blocked keywords. Credits are not charged.

post.description:
The `SerpstatTaskProcedure.getTaskResult` method brings in volume parsing results using `taskId` which was obtained with `SerpstatTaskProcedure.addKeywordListFreq`.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

pageSize.description: Number of results per a page

total.description: Total number of keywords for a task excluding blocked and duplicates

pageSize.description: Number of results found on a page

keyword.description: Keyword with obtained volume parameters, CPC and filters

keyword.raw.description: Keyword sent for position check by user. Exclude special elements for position check (*, +, -, @, ~, !, &, |, (, ), :, ,, ., ;)

status.description:
Position check statuses are following:
* **2** - position check completed successfully. Data is in keyword data.
* **4** - error getting data from Google.

Possible reasons for the error:
1. A prohibited data region was selected: Cuba, Iran, Sudan, Syria, North Korea, russia [terrorist country];
2. Google did not provide information for the phrase;
3. Google replaced some of the characters in the phrase. In this case, we cannot provide information about the original wording of the phrase.

cost.description: Average CPC in Google Ads for the last year in USD

searchVolume.description: Search volume for the selected region and match type

competition.description: Keyword competition in Google Ads for Google (1-100%), the keyword percentage slots for Ad in the selected region

searchVolumeHistory.description: Keyword search volume history for the last 12 months

date.description: the first day of a month in the format `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS`

post.description:
The `SerpstatTaskProcedure.getTaskStatus` method helps to obtain a position's check status with `taskId` by `SerpstatTaskProcedure.addKeywordListFreq`.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

totalKeywords.description: Total number of keywords in a task flagged for position checking

status.description:
The possible statuses for position checks are as follows:

* **0** - The keyword is stored and ready for parsing.
* **1** - The keyword has been sent for a position check (in progress).
* **2** - The position check was completed successfully, and the data is available.
* **3** - Error occurred while sending the keyword to the queue.
* **4** - Position check failed due to an error.

count.description: Number of keywords with stated above status

progress.description: Task progress. Total keywords ratio in a task to the number of keywords with 2-4 status (percentage)

requestId.title: requestId
requestId.description: The request identifier provided by the client. It will be echoed as field `id` in the response. Example `"id":"123"`

regionId.title: regionId
regionId.description:
Region or city identifier. Reffer to full list of [region ids](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1LUDtm-L1qWMVpmWuN-nvDyYFfQtfiXUh5LIHE8sjs0k/edit#gid=75443986)

Example: `21176`(Texas)

typeDeviceId.title: typeId
typeDeviceId.description:
Device type identifier

* **1** â€” Desktop
* **2** â€” Mobile

taskId.title: task_id
taskId.description: Query id to get parsing results with `SerpstatTaskProcedure.getTaskResult`
